meanings.definition: To perform less well than expected or required.
meanings.sent1: The student underperforms in math class and needs extra help.
meanings.sent2: The new engine underperforms compared to the old one.
meanings.sent3: The toaster underperforms and takes forever to toast a slice of bread.
meanings.sent4: The team underperforms on the field, letting their fans down.
meanings.sent5: The phone battery underperforms, dying after just a few hours of use.

meanings.definition: To fail to achieve a desired level of performance.
meanings.sent1: The athlete underperforms in the final race of the season.
meanings.sent2: The company underperforms in meeting its sales targets for the quarter.
meanings.sent3: The vacuum cleaner underperforms and leaves dirt behind on the carpet.
meanings.sent4: The singer underperforms at the concert, forgetting the lyrics to their own song.
meanings.sent5: The car underperforms on the highway, struggling to maintain speed uphill.
